review: might not be as techy as neovim or emacs but still a phenomenal ide that is exceptionally intuitive and thorough
still new but already has tons of great features like easy split screen manipulation, in-depth customization, integration with websites like gmail and google calendar, spaces, and arc max
a great offline note taking system that is customizable, fast, and intuitive (WONDERFUL COMMUNITY PLUGINS LIKE LATEX SUITE AND OMNISEARCH)
super chill music app, sometimes annoying because cant use files etc but overall solid
super customizable terminal app (best feature: cmd-d and cmd-shift-d to make split panels)
super customizable macos keyboard shortcut system that is super easy to use (ai is great at writing the scripts)
great basic window manager (all i know is full screen, split left, and split right and that covers 99% of my use cases)

pretty good pw manager, only thing is on mobile sometimes it doesnt detect when i need to input a password (maybe its just ios messing with me to get me to switch to its manager though). everything on macos is pretty good
insanely underrated notes app; has good shortcuts for everything; free syncing; folders; images; search; linking to notes; the only thing i need is a strikethrough command
pretty good, nice that it syncs with phone
imo better than cursor because you dont have to keep providing context, also maybe placebo or recency bias but the ai seems better
